[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/lib.rs] [Function: find_value()] [Panic vulnerability] Can an attacker cause test panics by providing malformed JSON arrays that don't match the filter predicate, potentially masking real security issues in production code during testing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/lib.rs] [Function: find_value()] [Logic error] Does the multiple-match panic in find_value() properly handle edge cases where legitimate resources have duplicate entries, potentially hiding state corruption bugs in actual blockchain code? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/lib.rs] [Function: assert_json()] [Test bypass] Can malformed JSON structures bypass equality checks in assert_json(), allowing invalid transaction formats to pass tests that should catch security vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/lib.rs] [Function: current_function_name!()] [Regex injection] Can the regex pattern in current_function_name!() be exploited with specially crafted module names to cause test failures or bypass golden file validation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/lib.rs] [Function: current_function_name!()] [Path traversal] Does the string manipulation in current_function_name!() properly sanitize output to prevent directory traversal when creating golden files? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/test_context.rs] [Function: new_test_context_inner()] [Seed determinism] Does the fixed RNG seed [0u8; 32] in new_test_context_inner() create predictable key generation that could be exploited if test code accidentally runs in production? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/test_context.rs] [Function: new_test_context_inner()] [Genesis manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate the genesis_config.recurring_lockup_duration_secs to create test environments that don't reflect production staking security constraints? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/test_context.rs] [Function: new_test_context_inner()] [Database race condition] Can concurrent calls to new_test_context_inner() cause database conflicts when multiple tests run in parallel, potentially corrupting test state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/test_context.rs] [Function: new_test_context_inner()] [Resource cleanup] Does the TempPath cleanup properly handle all database connections and file handles, or can resource leaks accumulate during long-running test suites? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/test_context.rs] [Function: new_test_context_inner()] [Indexer subscription] Can the version update subscriber mechanism cause race conditions between storage commits and indexer reads in concurrent test scenarios? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/test_context.rs] [Struct: TestContext] [Concurrent access] Is the TestContext struct properly synchronized when cloned and used across multiple async tasks, or can Arc/Mutex issues cause data races? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/test_context.rs] [Struct: TestContext] [RNG state] Can the cloneable rand::rngs::StdRng lead to duplicate random values across cloned contexts, creating predictable transaction nonces or signatures in tests? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/test-context/src/test_context.rs] [Struct: TestContext] [Root key exposure] Does the ConfigKey<Ed25519PrivateKey> properly protect the root private key from accidental serialization or logging in test output? (Medium)
